column2: 2. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 4. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column10: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

column2: 5. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column8: Steep downgrade

column2: 7. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
slow down.
column10: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column8: Curve ahead
Right turns not allowed.

column2: 11. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 12. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.
column8: come to a complete stop.

column2: 13. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: wait for the next green light.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.

column8: No U-turn
No parking on pavement.

column6: Watch out for children crossing the street
column8: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children

when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 19. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 20. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column8: excessive driving

column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 23. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column8: suggested

column2: 24. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:

column2: 26. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column10: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 27. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.
